'''Rick Law''' (born December 15, 1969) is an American entertainment [[illustrator]] and [[Film producer|producer]]. His clients have included [[The Walt Disney Company|Walt Disney Studios]], [[Paramount Pictures]] and [[MTV]], among others.
For [[The Walt Disney Company]], Law created cover art for a number of the studio's video, DVD, & Blu-Ray releases.<ref>https://web.archive.org/web/20160304091622/http://journalism.lincolnhigh.net/arts/2004/12/Drawing_with_the_wonderful_world_of_Disney</ref><ref>http://mousechat.net/scribbles-nibbles-disney-art/</ref> Some of those include: ''[[The Adventures of Ichabod and Mr. Toad]]''; ''[[The Lion King II: Simba's Pride]]''; ''[[The Rescuers Down Under]]''; [[One Hundred and One Dalmatians|''101 Dalmatians'']]; [[Tinker Bell (film)|''Tinker Bell'']]; ''[[Piglet's Big Movie]]''; [[Springtime with Roo|''Winnie the Pooh: Springtime with Roo'']]; ''[[Tarzan & Jane]]''; ''[[Mickey's Once Upon a Christmas]]'', and the first three 'Buddies' films: ''[[Air Buddies]]'', ''[[Snow Buddies]]'', and ''[[Space Buddies]]''.<ref>https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0492377/</ref>
In 1995 Law created the [[supernatural]] themed black & white [[comics|comic]] series ''[[Beyond the Veil (comics)|Beyond the Veil]]'', both writing and illustrating the series.<ref>http://www.lambiek.net/artists/l/law-rick.htm</ref>
In 1996, Law illustrated ''Pond and Stream : Habitats'' {{ISBN|1557995680}} for children's educational publisher Evan-Moor.<ref>http://www.jacketflap.com/bookdetail.asp?bookid=1557995680</ref>
In late 2001, Law founded and produced the [[9/11 Memorial Project - Los Angeles]]. In oversight of that effort, he became a regarded authority on the events of September 11, 2001, in particular as an expert in the curation and preservation of artifacts and objects from the 9/11 attacks.<ref>http://www.thefreelibrary.com/9%2F11+'SOUVENIR'+FURY.-a0133559764</ref><ref>http://www.ca911memorial.org/pdf/research/artifactsforsale.pdf</ref> Law received a 'Special Thanks' credit in the [[Academy Awards|Oscar]] nominated film [[United 93]].<ref>https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0475276/fullcredits/</ref>
In 2009, Law started designing toys with his reinterpretations of Disney characters via toy manufacturer MINDstyle.<ref>http://www.mindstyle.com/blog/?p=4670</ref> In support of the release of ''[[Toy Story 3]]'' in Asia, Law was a primary artist for the ''Alien Invasion Tour'', which debuted at [[Times Square (Hong Kong)|Times Square mall in Hong Kong]], with artistic reinterpretations of the [[List of Toy Story characters#Squeeze Toy Aliens .2F Little Green Men|''Toy Story'' alien character]]. <ref>http://www.vinylpulse.com/2010/06/mindstyle-alien-invasion-when-aliens-meet-artists.html</ref>
